ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Kunark and new stuff
ygData.msgSnippet: Easy: According to the statistics evidenced SO FAR... I remind you this is TOTALLY stupid to be upset over stuff that is on Test Server.  Odds are they have
ygData.messageBody:
Easy:

According to the statistics evidenced SO FAR... I remind you this is TOTALLY
stupid to be upset over stuff that is on Test Server. Odds are they have
those there to test how they work at that level. Anyway, according to what
is there "So Far" each caster will _STILL_ be getting about 8-10 spells per
5 levels or so

They _already_ get that. This just staggers it out for them instead of
making them wait through 5 hell levels to get to their spells.

Again, what has changed? They still get 10 spells every 5 levels
We still get 1 song every level

So WHAT if it takes longer?

Class Envy "They get spells every level just like we do now! Oh my god it's
the end of the world!!!!! This isn't fair! We should get more than 1 song
every level to compensate for the fact that they're getting 1 or 2 spells a
level!"

I repeat: What has changed?

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Friday, March 03, 2000 12:51 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Kunark and new stuff


From: <kim@...>

On Thu, 2 Mar 2000, Kevin L. Crawford wrote:
>
> As I have posted on Concert hall. What _difference_ does it make? They
get
> 1 or 2 spells a level instead of 8-10 every 4 or 5 levels? Who cares?
>
> So, after 5 levels they get 10 spells. They already get 10 spells every 5
> levels. What's changed?

I'm assuming the spell list is incomplete, considering there
aren't any bard songs on it.

> We get 1 spell per level, we will get 1 spell per level... again... what's
> changed?

The levels now take a *lot* longer. That's what's changed.
If they follow the one-song-per-level rule, our rate of new
songs *will* be decreased, regardless of what they do with
other classes. Whether the same is true for spellcasting
classes remains to be seen. Dunno how you got class envy out
of that.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
